pair.Response:
Prompt: Northern Securities Co. v. United States (1903)
Response: In this case, the Northern Securities Company denied each and every allegation in the petition, including that it was attempting to monopolize or restrain any trade or commerce among the states, or with foreign nations. The company also denied any agreement, promise, or understanding between any of the holders of the stock concerning the sale thereof to it. The company had expended over forty million dollars in cash to purchase shares of the Great Northern Company and the Northern Pacific Company. The company also denied all allegations in the petition regarding the purchase of shares of the Chicago, Burlington and Quincy Railroad Company.
